solution_line_template: At their following away game, Lola's team scored half as many points as at their home game, so they scored {last_home_game_score} / {half_divisor} = <<{last_home_game_score}/{half_divisor}={first_away_game_score}>>{first_away_game_score} points.

At the second away game, they scored {first_away_game_score} + {points_more_second_away} = <<{first_away_game_score}+{points_more_second_away}={second_away_game_score}>>{second_away_game_score} points.
At the third away game, they scored {second_away_game_score} + {points_more_third_away} = <<{second_away_game_score}+{points_more_third_away}={third_away_game_score}>>{third_away_game_score} points.

A cumulative score of four times their last home game is {cumulative_multiplier} * {last_home_game_score} = <<{cumulative_multiplier}*{last_home_game_score}={goal_cumulative_points}>>{goal_cumulative_points} points.

Thus, Lola's team has to score {goal_cumulative_points} - {current_cumulative_points} = <<{goal_cumulative_points}-{current_cumulative_points}={points_needed_next_game}>>{points_needed_next_game} points to bring their cumulative points up to {goal_cumulative_points}.
